cast.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to make light or a shadow appear somewhere
cast.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: the shade cast by low-hanging branches
The flames cast dancing shadows on the walls.
cast.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to look quickly in a particular direction
cast.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: She blushed, casting her eyes down.
She cast an anguished look at Guy.
The young tramp cast him a wary glance.
cast.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to make an object by pouring liquid metal, plastic etc into a mould (=hollow container)
cast.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: a statue of a horse cast in bronze
cast.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to choose which people will act particular parts in a play, film etc
cast.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The producer finally cast Finch in the male lead.
cast somebody in a role/a part/the lead
Pfeiffer was expected to be cast alongside Douglas in ‘Basic Instinct’.
Coppola cast him as Sodapop in ‘The Outsiders’.
cast.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: to regard or describe someone as a particular type of person
cast.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Clarke’s trying to cast me in the role of villain here.
Clinton had cast himself as the candidate of new economic opportunity.
cast.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: Sparks leapt as he cast more wood on the fire.
cast.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: to throw a fishing line or net into the water
cast.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: There’s a trick to casting properly.
cast.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: to force someone to go somewhere unpleasant
cast.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: Memet should, in her opinion, be cast into prison.
cast.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: when a snake casts its skin, the top layer of skin falls off slowly
cast.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: all the people who perform in a play, film etc
cast.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: a strong supporting cast (=everyone except the main actors)
Films like ‘Ben Hur’ have a cast of thousands.
cast.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a hard protective case that is put over your arm, leg etc because the bone is broken
cast.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Murray has his leg in a cast.
cast.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a mould (=hollow container) into which you pour liquid metal, plastic etc in order to make an object of a particular shape, or the object made in this way
cast.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: Make a cast of the statue.
cast.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: the act of throwing a fishing line into the water
cast.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: a small amount of a particular colour
cast.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: Sage leaves have a silvery cast.
cast.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: a problem with your eye which causes it to look sideways
cast.translation[1].definitions[6].defin: a small pile of earth that a worm produces on the surface of the ground
cast.translation[1].note_box[0].sections: The play has a strong cast of new young actors.
It's a fantastic production with an enormously talented cast.
The movie features an all-star cast.
There’s also a fine supporting cast.
The play had a cast of almost unknown actors.
Al Pacino heads the cast of this political thriller.
a cast member/a member of the cast
Everyone remembers the cast members of 'Friends’.
The movie has an impressive cast list.
cast.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a program that is put on the Internet for people to download
cast.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to vote for someone or vote in an election
cast.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Justice Kennedy cast the deciding vote in the 5-4 ruling.
